paper_abstract: A tree is called chemical if no vertex of it has a degree greater than four. The general Randic, index R-alpha(G) for a graph G is defined as Sigma((uv))(d(u)d(v))(alpha), where uv is an edge of G alpha is an element of R and alpha not equal 0. In this paper, we completely characterize the structures of chemical trees with the minimum or maximum general Randic index R-alpha for alpha > 0.
paper_title: Extremal chemical trees with minimum or maximum general Randic index
